name: HD 183263
scenarioDescription:
The HD 183263 Exoplanetary System


Overview

HD 183263 is a star with 1.31 times the mass of the Sun, and 1.23 times its radius. It is located 177.04 light years away from the solar system.

HD 183263 is known to have 2 exoplanets in orbit around it.


Exoplanets in the HD 183263 system


HD 183263 b

HD 183263 b was discovered by the W. M. Keck Observatory observatory using the radial velocity method. Its semi-major axis is 1.49 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. The mass of HD 183263 b is 1256.1000000000001 times the mass of Earth. At more than 50 Earth masses, HD 183263 b is a gas giant, a planet whose mass is mostly made up of hydrogen and helium, like Jupiter and Saturn in our solar system.


HD 183263 c

HD 183263 c was discovered by the W. M. Keck Observatory observatory using the radial velocity method. Its semi-major axis is 4.35 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. The mass of HD 183263 c is 1135.26 times the mass of Earth. At more than 50 Earth masses, HD 183263 c is a gas giant, a planet whose mass is mostly made up of hydrogen and helium, like Jupiter and Saturn in our solar system.
description: 3D visualisation and gravity simulation of the exoplanet system HD 183263, which contains 2 planets and was discovered by W. M. Keck Observatory.
